intro: Macleania pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered macleania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has small, leathery leaves and produces fragrant, nectar-rich blooms. Macleania pauciflora is often found in humid, shaded environments within rainforests.
